DPRK Ambassador to Uganda Appointed 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Pak Hyon Jae was appointed as DPRK ambassador e. p. to Uganda, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Japan's Reckless Attempt at Preemptive Attack Assailed
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Patriotic Movement for National Unity
articles.content:
Japan's Reckless Attempt at Preemptive Attack Assailed 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Japan formally decided to jointly develop a missile defence system with the U.S. In this regard, Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article observes: It is the intention of the Japanese reactionaries to mount a preemptive armed attack on the DPRK and, furthermore, start a war of aggression against its neighboring countries.
 The U.S. and Japanese reactionaries made such decision under the pretext of "the nuclear threat" from the DPRK, the article notes, and goes on: The story of "the missile threat" from the DPRK much touted by the Japanese reactionaries is nothing but sophism intended to justify their moves for the joint development of the above-said system with the U.S., their ambition for reinvasion and attempt at a preemptive attack.    
 It is the unchangeable intention of the Japanese reactionaries to realize their ambition for reinvasion with ease, backed by the U.S.
 The above-mentioned decision was made by Japan on the basis of its cunning calculation. That is to say, the Japanese reactionaries seek to use the signboard of "defence" for pulling  the wool over the eyes of the Asian countries and the rest of the world that remain cautious against their moves for overseas aggression and stepping up their moves to turn Japan into a military power and their preparations for a preemptive attack. 
 Given the outcries made by them that Japan would not rule out even a "preemptive attack" to cope with the "nuclear and missile threats" from the DPRK and it may fight a war with north Korea, the decision made by Tokyo recently cannot but be a serious development which can never be overlooked.
 Should the Japanese militarist forces again rush headlong into overseas aggression with the backing of a big country, failing to draw a lesson from the defeat of the Japanese imperialists in the last century, they will meet final destruction.
